Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in finding that the applicants failed to rebut the presumption of state protection
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee status due to threats from ELN/FARC
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected the refugee claim based on presumed state protection
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, setting aside of RPD decision, re-determination
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; RPD decision set aside; case remitted for re-determination
Defendant_Behavior: RPD relied on limited evidence and ignored key documents
Grounds_for_Claim: Threats from ELN/FARC due to political opinion or membership in a particular social group
Assessment_Factor: Inadequate state protection, individualized risk assessment
Evidence_Used: Documents showing inadequate state protection, evidence of targeting by ELN/FARC
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution by non-state actors (ELN/FARC)
Evidence_Assessed: Key documents showing lack of state protection were not properly considered
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness requires justification, transparency, and intelligibility in RPD decisions
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD failed to consider relevant evidence on state protection
Outcome: RPD decision found unreasonable; case remitted
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board - Refugee Protection Division (IRB-RPD)
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from ELN/FARC due to lack of effective state protection
Cause_Description: Applicants faced threats from ELN/FARC and could not access state protection
Evidence_Handling: RPD ignored key evidence regarding state incapacity to protect
Evidence_Issues: Failure to individualize analysis, reliance on insufficient evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient and non-transparent evaluation of evidence by RPD
Decision_Rationale: Decision was not justified, transparent, or intelligible; lacked individualized assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Overlooked critical documentation on state protection failures
